Class CSVoperator

java.lang.Object
CSV.CSVoperator
Direct Known Subclasses:
AppointmentCSVOperator, DoctorCSVOperator, MedicalRecordCSVOperator, MedicineCSVOperator, StaffCSVOperator
public abstract class CSVoperator extends Object
An abstract class that defines operations for reading, adding, changing, and deleting lines in CSV files. The file can store information related to appointments for different roles such as patient, doctor, pharmacist, and admin.

  • Constructor Details

    • CSVoperator

      public CSVoperator()
      Default constructor for CSVoperator. This constructor is implicitly provided by Java and is used to instantiate subclasses that inherit from this class. No specific initialization is needed in this class.

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      public abstract ArrayList<String> readFile(String id, int role)
      Reads the file of the CSV and returns specific information for a specific role with its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the entity (e.g., patient, doctor, pharmacist, admin).
      role - The role associated with the ID. 0 represents patient, 1 represents doctor, 2 represents pharmacist, 3 represents admin.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings containing the specific data for the given role and ID.

    • addLineToFile

      public abstract boolean addLineToFile(List<String> dataAdd)
      Adds a new line to the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      dataAdd - A list of strings containing the data to be added to the file.
      Returns:
      True if the line is successfully added, otherwise false.

    • changeSpecificInformation

      public abstract boolean changeSpecificInformation(String id, ArrayList<Integer> changesIndex, ArrayList<String> changes)
      Changes a specific piece of information in the file, based on the provided ID and changes.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the entry to be updated.
      changesIndex - A list of integer indices specifying which fields in the line to update.
      changes - A list of strings containing the new values for the fields to be updated.
      Returns:
      True if the information is successfully changed, otherwise false.

    • deleteSpecificLine

      public abstract boolean deleteSpecificLine(String id)
      Deletes a specific line from the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the entry to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if the line is successfully deleted, otherwise false.

    • splitCommaCSVLine

      public String[] splitCommaCSVLine(String line)
      Splits a CSV line into individual tokens, taking into account quoted values. This method is particularly useful for handling CSV lines that contain commas inside quotes.
      Parameters:
      line - The CSV line to be split.
      Returns:
      An array of strings, where each string is a token (field) from the CSV line.
